verses.verse: It <S%H3130><s%> happened <S%H6651><s%> at the <S%H1250><s%> end of two <S%H2344><s%> full years, <S%H3220><s%> that Pharaoh <S%H3966><s%> dreamed: <S%H7235><s%> and behold, <S%H2308><s%> he stood by the river. <S%H5608><s%>

Behold, <S%H5927><s%> there came up out of the river <S%H2975><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> cattle, <S%H6510><s%> sleek <S%H3303><s%> and <S%H4758><s%> fat, <S%H1277><s%> and they fed <S%H7462><s%> in the marsh grass. <S%H260><s%>

Behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven other <S%H312><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> after them <S%H310><s%> out of the river, <S%H2975><s%> ugly <S%H7451><s%> and <S%H4758><s%> thin, <S%H1851><s%> and stood <S%H5975><s%> by <S%H681><s%> the other cattle <S%H6510><s%> on the brink <S%H8193><s%> of the river. <S%H2975><s%>

The ugly <S%H7451><s%> and <S%H4758><s%> thin <S%H1851><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> ate up <S%H398><s%> the seven <S%H7651><s%> sleek <S%H3303><s%> and <S%H4758><s%> fat <S%H1277><s%> cattle. <S%H6510><s%> So Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> awoke. <S%H3364><s%>

He slept <S%H3462><s%> and dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a second time: <S%H8145><s%> and behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven heads of grain <S%H7641><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> on one <S%H259><s%> stalk, <S%H7070><s%> healthy <S%H1277><s%> and good. <S%H2896><s%>
Behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain, <S%H1851><s%> thin and blasted <S%H7710><s%> with the east wind, <S%H6921><s%> sprung up <S%H6779><s%> after them. <S%H310><s%>

The thin <S%H1851><s%> heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain swallowed <S%H1104><s%> up the seven <S%H7651><s%> healthy <S%H1277><s%> and full <S%H4392><s%> ears. <S%H7641><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> awoke, <S%H3364><s%> and behold, <S%H2472><s%> it was a dream.

It happened in the morning <S%H1242><s%> that his spirit <S%H7307><s%> was troubled, <S%H6470><s%> and he sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> for all of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>'s magicians <S%H2748><s%> and wise men. <S%H2450><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> them his dreams, <S%H2472><s%> but there was no one who could interpret <S%H6622><s%> them to Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%>
Then the chief <S%H8269><s%> cupbearer <S%H8248><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "I remember <S%H2142><s%> my faults <S%H2399><s%> today. <S%H3117><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> was angry <S%H7107><s%> with his servants, <S%H5650><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> me in custody <S%H4929><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the guard, <S%H2876><s%> me and the chief <S%H8269><s%> baker. <S%H644><s%>

We dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a dream <S%H2472><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> night, <S%H3915><s%> I and he. <S%H2492><s%> We dreamed each man <S%H376><s%> according to the interpretation <S%H6623><s%> of his dream. <S%H2472><s%>

There was with us there a young man, <S%H5288><s%> a Hebrew, <S%H5680><s%> servant <S%H5650><s%> to the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the guard, <S%H2876><s%> and we told <S%H5608><s%> him, <S%H6622><s%> and he interpreted to us our dreams. <S%H2472><s%> To each man <S%H376><s%> according to his dream <S%H2472><s%> he interpreted. <S%H6622><s%>
It happened, <S%H6622><s%> as he interpreted to us, <S%H7725><s%> so it was: he restored me to my office, <S%H3653><s%> and he hanged him. <S%H8518><s%>"

Then Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> and they brought him hastily <S%H7323><s%> out of the dungeon. <S%H953><s%> He shaved <S%H1548><s%> himself, <S%H2498><s%> changed his clothing, <S%H8071><s%> and came in <S%H935><s%> to Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "I have dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a dream, <S%H2472><s%> and there is no one who can interpret <S%H6622><s%> it. <S%H8085><s%> I have heard it said <S%H559><s%> of you, <S%H8085><s%> that when you hear a dream <S%H2472><s%> you can interpret it. <S%H6622><s%>"

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "It isn't <S%H1107><s%> in me. God <S%H430><s%> will give <S%H6030><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> an answer <S%H6030><s%> of peace. <S%H7965><s%>"
Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "In my dream, <S%H2472><s%> behold, <S%H5975><s%> I stood on the brink <S%H8193><s%> of the river: <S%H2975><s%>

and behold, <S%H5927><s%> there came up out of the river <S%H2975><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> cattle, <S%H6510><s%> fat <S%H1277><s%> and <S%H3303><s%> sleek. <S%H8389><s%> They fed <S%H7462><s%> in the marsh grass, <S%H260><s%>

and behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven other <S%H312><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> after them, <S%H310><s%> poor <S%H1803><s%> and very <S%H3966><s%> ugly <S%H7451><s%> and <S%H8389><s%> thin, <S%H7534><s%> such <S%H2007><s%> as I never <S%H3808><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> in all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> for ugliness. <S%H7455><s%>
The thin <S%H7534><s%> and ugly <S%H7451><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> ate up <S%H398><s%> the first <S%H7223><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> fat <S%H1277><s%> cattle, <S%H6510><s%>

and when they had eaten them up, <S%H935><s%> it couldn't <S%H3045><s%> be known that they had eaten them, <S%H935><s%> but they were still <S%H4758><s%> ugly, <S%H7451><s%> as at the beginning. <S%H8462><s%> So I awoke. <S%H3364><s%>

I saw <S%H7200><s%> in my dream, <S%H2472><s%> and behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain came up <S%H5927><s%> on one <S%H259><s%> stalk, <S%H7070><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> and good: <S%H2896><s%>

and behold, <S%H7651><s%> seven heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain, <S%H6798><s%> withered, thin, <S%H1851><s%> and blasted <S%H7710><s%> with the east wind, <S%H6921><s%> sprung up <S%H6779><s%> after them. <S%H310><s%>

The thin <S%H1851><s%> heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain swallowed <S%H1104><s%> up the seven <S%H7651><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain. <S%H559><s%> I told it to the magicians, <S%H2748><s%> but there was no one who could explain it to me. <S%H5046><s%>"

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> "The dream <S%H2472><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> is one. <S%H259><s%> What God <S%H430><s%> is about to do <S%H6213><s%> he has declared <S%H5046><s%> to Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%>

The seven <S%H7651><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> are seven <S%H7651><s%> years; <S%H8141><s%> and the seven <S%H7651><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain are seven <S%H7651><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%> The dream <S%H2472><s%> is one. <S%H259><s%>

The seven <S%H7651><s%> thin <S%H7534><s%> and ugly <S%H7451><s%> cattle <S%H6510><s%> that came up <S%H5927><s%> after them <S%H310><s%> are seven <S%H7651><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and also the seven <S%H7651><s%> empty <S%H7386><s%> heads <S%H7641><s%> of grain blasted <S%H7710><s%> with the east wind; <S%H6921><s%> they will be seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of famine. <S%H7458><s%>
That is the thing <S%H1697><s%> which I spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%> What God <S%H430><s%> is about to do <S%H6213><s%> he has shown <S%H7200><s%> to Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%>
Behold, <S%H935><s%> there come seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of great <S%H1419><s%> plenty <S%H7647><s%> throughout all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

There will arise <S%H6965><s%> after them <S%H310><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of famine, <S%H7458><s%> and all the plenty <S%H7647><s%> will be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> The famine <S%H7458><s%> will consume <S%H3615><s%> the land, <S%H776><s%>

and the plenty <S%H7647><s%> will not be known <S%H3045><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> by reason <S%H6440><s%> of that famine <S%H7458><s%> which follows; <S%H310><s%> for it will be very <S%H3966><s%> grievous. <S%H3515><s%>

The dream <S%H2472><s%> was doubled <S%H8138><s%> to <S%H6471><s%> Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> because the thing <S%H1697><s%> is established <S%H3559><s%> by <S%H5973><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> will shortly <S%H4116><s%> bring it to pass. <S%H6213><s%>

"Now therefore let Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> look for <S%H7200><s%> a discreet <S%H995><s%> and wise <S%H2450><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> and set <S%H7896><s%> him over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Let Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> this, <S%H6485><s%> and let him appoint overseers over the land, <S%H776><s%> and take up the fifth part <S%H2567><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>'s produce in the seven <S%H7651><s%> plenteous <S%H7647><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>

Let them gather <S%H6908><s%> all the food <S%H400><s%> of these good <S%H2896><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> that come, <S%H935><s%> and lay up <S%H6651><s%> grain <S%H1250><s%> under the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> for food <S%H400><s%> in the cities, <S%H5892><s%> and let them keep it. <S%H8104><s%>

The food <S%H400><s%> will be for a store <S%H6487><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> against the seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of famine, <S%H7458><s%> which will be in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> that the land <S%H776><s%> not perish <S%H3772><s%> through the famine. <S%H7458><s%>"
The thing <S%H1697><s%> was good <S%H3190><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of all his servants. <S%H5650><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his servants, <S%H5650><s%> "Can we find <S%H4672><s%> such a one as this, <S%H2088><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> in whom <S%H834><s%> is the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God? <S%H430><s%>"

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "Because <S%H310><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has shown <S%H3045><s%> you all of this, <S%H995><s%> there is none so discreet and wise as you. <S%H2450><s%>

You shall be <S%H1961><s%> over my house, <S%H1004><s%> and according to your word <S%H6310><s%> will all my people <S%H5971><s%> be ruled. <S%H5401><s%> Only in the throne <S%H3678><s%> I will be greater than you. <S%H1431><s%>"
Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "Behold, <S%H7200><s%> I have set <S%H5414><s%> you over all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>"

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> took off <S%H5493><s%> his signet ring <S%H2885><s%> from his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> it on Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s hand, <S%H3027><s%> and arrayed <S%H6440><s%> him in robes <S%H899><s%> of fine linen, <S%H8336><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> a gold <S%H2091><s%> chain <S%H7242><s%> about his neck, <S%H6677><s%>

and he made him to ride <S%H7392><s%> in the second <S%H4932><s%> chariot <S%H4818><s%> which he had. <S%H7121><s%> They cried before him, <S%H6440><s%> "Bow the knee! <S%H86><s%>" He set him <S%H6440><s%> over all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "I am Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and without <S%H1107><s%> you shall no man <S%H376><s%> lift up <S%H7311><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> or his foot <S%H7272><s%> in all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>"

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%> Zaphenath-Paneah; <S%H6847><s%> and he gave <S%H5414><s%> him Asenath, <S%H621><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Potiphera <S%H6319><s%> priest <S%H3548><s%> of On <S%H204><s%> as a wife. <S%H802><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> was thirty <S%H7970><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he stood <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and went throughout <S%H5674><s%> all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
In the seven <S%H7651><s%> plenteous <S%H7647><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> produced <S%H6213><s%> abundantly. <S%H7062><s%>

He gathered up <S%H6908><s%> all the food <S%H400><s%> of the seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> which were in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and laid up <S%H5414><s%> the food <S%H400><s%> in the cities: <S%H5892><s%> the food <S%H400><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> which was around <S%H5439><s%> every city, <S%H5892><s%> he laid up <S%H5414><s%> in the same. <S%H8432><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> laid <S%H6651><s%> up grain <S%H1250><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> much, <S%H7235><s%> until he stopped <S%H2308><s%> counting, <S%H5608><s%> for it was without <S%H369><s%> number. <S%H4557><s%>

To Joseph <S%H3130><s%> were born <S%H3205><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> before the year <S%H8141><s%> of famine <S%H7458><s%> came, <S%H935><s%> whom Asenath, <S%H621><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Potiphera <S%H6319><s%> priest <S%H3548><s%> of On, <S%H204><s%> bore to him. <S%H3205><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> "For, <S%H430><s%>" he said, "God has made me forget <S%H5382><s%> all my toil, <S%H5999><s%> and all my father <S%H1><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%>"

The name <S%H8034><s%> of the second, <S%H8145><s%> he called <S%H7121><s%> Ephraim: <S%H669><s%> "For God <S%H430><s%> has made me fruitful <S%H6509><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of my affliction. <S%H6040><s%>"
The seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of plenty, <S%H7647><s%> that were in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> came to an end. <S%H3615><s%>

The seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> of famine <S%H7458><s%> began <S%H2490><s%> to come, <S%H935><s%> just as Joseph <S%H3130><s%> had said. <S%H559><s%> There was famine <S%H7458><s%> in all lands, <S%H776><s%> but in all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> there was bread. <S%H3899><s%>

When all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> was famished, <S%H7456><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> cried <S%H6817><s%> to Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> for bread, <S%H3899><s%> and Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to all the Egyptians, <S%H4714><s%> "Go <S%H3212><s%> to Joseph. <S%H3130><s%> What he says <S%H559><s%> to you, <S%H6213><s%> do."

The famine <S%H7458><s%> was over all the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> opened <S%H6605><s%> all the store houses, <S%H7666><s%> and sold to the Egyptians. <S%H4714><s%> The famine <S%H7458><s%> was severe <S%H2388><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

All countries <S%H776><s%> came <S%H935><s%> into Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> grain, <S%H7458><s%> because the famine was severe <S%H2388><s%> in all the earth. <S%H776><s%>
